文献ID: STP458-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_1st Volume_022_chunk2
证据片段: in-flux corrosion rates were consistently accelerated in pH 10 LiOH, ~1 ppm oxygen

证据片段: Corrosion and hydriding rates differed on the three Zircaloy-2 lots

文献ID: STP458-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_1st Volume_022_chunk2
证据片段: The high corrosion rates established in the lithiated system continued on specimens transferred to the ammoniated system.

文献ID: STP458-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_1st Volume_022_chunk2
证据片段: The high corrosion rates established in the lithiated system continued on specimens transferred to the ammoniated system.

文献ID: STP458-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_1st Volume_022_chunk2
证据片段: By contrast, rates were low on as-etched Zircaloy-2 specimens started in the ammoniated system

文献ID: STP458-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_1st Volume_022_chunk2
证据片段: Between ETR cycles 75 and 82, rates on as-etched in-flux specimens were only slightly higher than rates on out-of-flux controls.

文献ID: STP458-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_1st Volume_022_chunk4
证据片段: The percentage of corrosion hydrogen absorbed was low (3 to 14 percent) for Zr-2.5Nb specimens

文献ID: STP458-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_1st Volume_022_chunk5
证据片段: the apparent surface roughness on Zircaloy-2 (Fig. 9a) was reflected in non-uniform oxide thickness

文献ID: STP458-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_1st Volume_022_chunk5
证据片段: No significant niobium segregation was observed in the substrate or at the oxide-metal interface

文献ID: STP458-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_1st Volume_022_chunk6
证据片段: Heinrich [20] reported that iron-nickel aggregates appeared to disperse in oxides on Zircaloy-2, while iron-chromium aggregates remained as separate phases, suggesting a low solubility of the Fe-Cr phase in the oxide.

文献ID: STP458-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_1st Volume_022_chunk6
证据片段: Copper segregation in the oxide on the Zr-Cu-Fe alloy tended to be nodular with no indication of bands associated with partings in the oxide (Fig. 17).

文献ID: STP458-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_1st Volume_022_chunk6
证据片段: Heinrich [20] found uniform copper distribution in a beta-quenched Zr-2.5Nb-0.5Cu alloy having good corrosion resistance.

文献ID: STP458-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_1st Volume_022_chunk6
证据片段: A similar specimen, having had an anneal in the alpha-plus-beta region, showed an inhomogeneous copper distribution in the oxide and also showed poor corrosion resistance.

文献ID: STP458-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_1st Volume_022_chunk6
证据片段: The favorable corrosion response of the niobium alloys in as-etched and prefilmed conditions provides considerable evidence that alloying with niobium can counteract accelerated corrosion attack in aggressive reactor systems.

文献ID: STP458-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_1st Volume_022_chunk6
证据片段: However, of the six alloys, only the Zr-Cu-Fe alloy showed highly unfavorable hydriding behavior, which occurred at in-flux and out-of-flux positions.

文献ID: STP458-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_1st Volume_022_chunk6
证据片段: Prefilming enhanced the in-flux corrosion of 174-day high-flux Zr-Cr-Fe, Zr-Cu-Fe and Zircaloy-2 by a factor of 2 compared to corresponding as-etched specimens.

文献ID: STP458-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_1st Volume_022_chunk6
证据片段: Results from another G-7 loop test [21] demonstrated that a thick prefilm oxide (~200-250 mg/dm²) can greatly accelerate in-flux corrosion, even in a system which is unaggressive toward as-etched specimens.

文献ID: STP458-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_1st Volume_022_chunk6
证据片段: On the other hand, absence of the non-uniform attack on low-flux and out-of-flux Zr-2.5Nb specimens indicates that some minimum level of flux (or fluence) is required to nucleate the nonuniform attack.

文献ID: STP458-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_1st Volume_022_chunk6
证据片段: Lithiated system (300 C prefilm): 350-530 mg/dm² (dependent on Zircaloy-2 lot)

文献ID: STP458-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_1st Volume_022_chunk7
证据片段: Non-uniform corrosion occurred on high-flux $Z \mathrm { r } { - } 2 . 5 \mathrm { N b }$ specimens, including pustules, pits, and crack networks

文献ID: STP458-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_1st Volume_022_chunk7
证据片段: The percentage of corrosion hydrogen absorbed did not change significantly with the upturn in corrosion rate observed in a 174-day exposure

文献ID: STP458-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_1st Volume_022_chunk7
证据片段: Monoclinic zirconia was the oxide phase on the six alloys after an exposure of $1 . 7 \times 1 0 ^ { 2 1 } \ n / \mathrm { c m } ^ { 2 }$ , $> 1$ MeV

文献ID: STP458-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_1st Volume_022_chunk8
证据片段: Results of corrosion tests on Ozhennite 0.5 in organic coolant and high-temperature steam are summarized

文献ID: STP458-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_1st Volume_022_chunk8
证据片段: The alloy shows improved corrosion and hydriding resistance compared to that of the commonly known zirconium alloys, the Zircaloys and 2.5Nb zirconium

文献ID: STP458-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_1st Volume_022_chunk8
证据片段: Mechanical properties of Ozhennite 0.5 pressure tubing and fuel cladding made by commercial methods are presented

文献ID: STP458-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_1st Volume_022_chunk8
证据片段: Both these systems involve the use of materials at temperatures of 400 to 500°C

文献ID: STP458-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_1st Volume_022_chunk8
证据片段: This alloy was reported by Russian workers as being corrosion-resistant to steam at temperatures as high as 450°C
